Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.function

Interface IntObjRelation<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the object of the relation
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface
public interface IntObjRelation<T>
Defines some kind of relationship between an integer and an object. For example, if x equals 6, and y is an int array containing 6, then the relation X element-of Y exists.
Author:
Ayco Holleman

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean exists​(int subject, T object)
    Whether or not the relationship between subject and object exists.
    static <X> IntObjRelation<X> not​(IntObjRelation<X> relation)
    Returns the negation of the specified relation.
    static <X> ObjIntRelation<X> reverse​(IntObjRelation<X> relation)
    Returns the reverse of the specified relation, swapping subject and object in the relationship.

  • Method Details

    • reverse

      static <X> ObjIntRelation<X> reverse​(IntObjRelation<X> relation)
      Returns the reverse of the specified relation, swapping subject and object in the relationship.
      Type Parameters:
      X - The type of the object of the original relation (and the subject of the returned ObjIntRelation)
      Parameters:
      relation - The IntObjRelation to return the reverse of
      Returns:
      An ObjIntRelation that is the reverse of the specified IntObjRelation.

    • not

      static <X> IntObjRelation<X> not​(IntObjRelation<X> relation)
      Returns the negation of the specified relation.
      Type Parameters:
      X - The type of the object of the original relation
      Parameters:
      relation - The IntObjRelation to return the negation of
      Returns:
      The negated IntObjRelation

    • exists

      boolean exists​(int subject, T object)
      Whether or not the relationship between subject and object exists.
      Parameters:
      subject - The subject of the relation (the entity from which the relationship extends)
      object - The object of the relation (the entity to which the relationship extends)
      Returns:
      true if the relation exists, false otherwise.
